snippet: A whole industry of “canners” walk the sidewalks in the wee hours of the morning collecting those castoff empties that can be redeemed for 5 cents each.
abstract: Francis X Clines The City Life column on Roman Catholic nun Ana Martinez de Luco, who created Sure We Can, project for the destitute; recounts how Sister Ana came to manage booming depot in Brooklyn where growing number of people who collect cans and bottles from New York City trash can trade recyclables for money.
lead_paragraph: A whole industry of “canners” walk the sidewalks in the wee hours of the morning collecting those castoff empties that can be redeemed for 5 cents each.

headline.seo: ‘Canners’ Work Overtime to Earn 5 Cents a Pop
